text: Gustav Klimt (14 July 1862 – 6 February 1918) was an Austrian Symbolist painter. He was one of the most prominent members of the Vienna Secession movement. His major works include paintings, mosaics, murals, sketches, and other art objects, some of them are inspired by Japanese art. Many of them are on display in the Vienna Secession gallery. Klimt's primary subject was the female body," The most important element of his fame is his reputation as a master of eroticism". Fleidel, Gottfried: "Gustav Klimt 1862-1918 The World in Female Form.", p. 14. Benedikt Taschen, 1994. and his works are marked by a frank eroticism — nowhere is this more apparent than in his numerous drawings in pencil (see Mulher sentada, below).Sabarsky, Serge, et al., Gustav Klimt: Drawings, p. 18. Moyer Bell Limited, 1983. Klimt died of influenza in Vienna in 1918. The painting Portrait of Fraulein Lieser, "was last seen in public in 1925",https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-68102376 until it was (sold or) auctioned in 2024. ==Pictures== File:The Kiss - Gustav Klimt - Google Cultural Institute.jpg|Kiss File:Gustav Klimt 039.jpg|Judith File:KlimtPanna.jpg|Jungfrauen File:Gustav Klimt 046.jpg|Adele Bloch-Bauer I File:Gustav Klimt 047.jpg|Adele Bloch-Bauer II, 1912 File:Gustav Klimt 068.jpg|Allee im Park von Schloss Kammer, 1912 File:Gustav Klimt 050.jpg|Portrait Eugenia (Mäda) Primavesi, 1912 File:Gustav Klimt 010.jpg|Dànae, 1907 File:Gustav Klimt 054.jpg|Johanna Staude File:Gustav Klimt 001.jpg|Adam and Eve File:Gustav Klimt 042.jpg|Malcesine, Lake of Garda File:Chiesaacassoneklimt.jpg|Church of Cassone at Malcesine File:Klimt Mulher sentada.jpg|Masturbation, 1913 ==References== Category:1862 births Category:1918 deaths Category:Austrian painters Category:Deaths from influenza
